review_text:
We loved our weekend getaway on the River!
We are a family of five, with three children ranging in age from 10 months to 14 years. Finding a space that accommodates everyone’s needs can be tricky, but this location was just what we needed.
The layout of the house was perfect. Open floor plans that provided plenty of space to move freely. Everyone had their own room and my 2 year old LOVED all the books and toys. I liked the use of the upstairs landing area; my kids could play upstairs while I was downstairs and everyone was heard. Bring a baby gate though if you have little ones who haven’t mastered stairs.
The kitchen was spacious and adequately stocked with pots, pan, and culinary equipment. We enjoyed cooking our own meals, making burgers on the deck, and s’mores in the fire pit. (We picked up groceries from the Kroger on the way in - about 20 minutes from the house.) The house does not have a high chair, so if you need one, bring it.
The aesthetics of the house is very appealing. Clean and spacious. Beautifully decorated. As mentioned in the post, the house isn’t finished; however, it’s doesn’t interfere too much with the stay. (There are some un-tiled areas, exposed plywood, etc. Nothing too major.) The master bedroom is spacious and comfortable. It has its own entry to the deck and it’s own bathroom. The bathroom has plenty of room. Unfortunately, the gorgeous bath takes too long to fill for it to be enjoyable.
One recommendation I would make is to install a stereo/speaker system. If you want to listen to music throughout the house, bring a portable speaker. We played it from our phones and it was fine, but a speaker system would add that extra refinement. There is a tv in the upstairs landing, but you can’t have the downstairs tv and the upstairs tv on at the same time. It may make more sense to move the landing tv to the bedroom.
We were very grateful to the hosts for giving us access to the canoes and kayaks. There are life vests for all ages. And easy, walk-in access to the river.
On Friday, we traveled 40 minutes to Tygart Lake and rented a pontoon boat. Definitely call the marina well in advance to reserve a boat. On Saturday, we went to Adams Street for the market and antique car show. Fairmont also has plenty of playgrounds for your little ones.
Overall, we loved our stay. Hosts were friendly and communicative. The house was clean and appealing. The river was easily accessible. There are neighbors immediately next to you, so it’s not a private getaway, but they were friendly and not noisy.
Thanks for a great time!

The Dairy Creme Corner has excellent and affordable food and ice cream, WildFlour restaurant is yummy as well. There is a local putt-putt golf place nearby too. Everything is within 15-30 min.

The loft makes it hard to watch TV both upstairs and down and noise really carries overall. The steps are extremely loud no matter how much you tiptoe and every door in the house squeaks.
Second, the access to the river is a bit frustrating. The basement exit is private to the owners and there is no safe walkway from the front of the house because you have to walk directly on the narrow gravel road. review_text: Heather's Haven was the perfect getaway spot for my family. It is in a peaceful location on the river, yet within 5 to 10 minutes of plenty of dining and shopping options. It is also only about 20 minutes from Morgantown, so a great location for a WVU football weekend or if you're coming to visit a student there. It is a beautiful cabin with everything that you need. We spent two nights and enjoyed fishing, playing on the river, sitting by the firepit, and relaxing! The sun porch is the perfect morning coffee spot. We rented paddleboards from Wood's Boat House just down the river (they were the nicest people!) which were so much fun and exhausting for the kids! Everyone had a nap afterwards. The washer/dryer at Heather's Haven was a much needed amenity after playing in the river! LOL! We tried the Dutchman's Daughter and Muriale's and had excellent meals from both. We did take out from Dutchman's Daughter and ate at the picnic table by the river at Heather's Haven. We dined in at Muriale's. Muriale's salad and bread would be a meal in itself! Go hungry! We also went to Pufferbelly's for ice cream...great soft serve and friendly people! We hope to return to Heather's Haven for another getaway, maybe a WVU football weekend this fall!

Highly recommend.
